intro: Mentzelia strictissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Mentzelia strictissima is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
